PROFILE  
Passionate, self -driven Chemical Engineer, eager to learn about Energy, Oil & Gas, 
Data Analytics, Consultancy, Leadership and Management. 4 years of experience 
in the oil & gas and energy industry as a process engineer  and data analyst.  
Process Monitoring and Analysis Engineer (Chemical Engineer)  
ExxonMobil Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia  / August 2017 – March 2019   
• Optimized and benchmarked unit process operations and performance 
for FCC, Alkylation, Fractionation, Furnace and Coker  technologies, to 
ensure safe and reliable operation, and maximize profitability . 
• Provided technical consultancy for 8 Ex xonMobil's downstream refineries 
in the US, Canada, Europe, UAE and Australia. Advised clients on 
operating strategy, achieved reliability and margin capture of $10   PROFILE  
Passionate, self -driven Chemical Engineer, eager to learn about Energy, Oil & Gas, 
Data Analytics, Consultancy, Leadership and Management. 4 years of experience 
in the oil & gas and energy industry as a process engineer  and data analyst.  
Process Monitoring and Analysis Engineer (Chemical Engineer)  
ExxonMobil Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia  / August 2017 – March 2019   
• Optimized and benchmarked unit process operations and performance 
for FCC, Alkylation, Fractionation, Furnace and Coker  technologies, to 
ensure safe and reliable operation, and maximize profitability . 
• Provided technical consultancy for 8 Ex xonMobil's downstream refineries 
in the US, Canada, Europe, UAE and Australia. Advised clients on 
operating strategy, achieved reliability and margin capture of $10 
Mil/year.  
• Involved in a $ 5 million worth FCC Riser project which doubled the unit ’s 
run-length, prevented unplanned shutdown and improved reliability. 
Provided support for  refinery  FCC Turnaround  and project 
commissioning . 
• Utilized JMP, SeeQ  Advance Analytics and Excel VBA to analyze process 
data and build prediction models (multivariate fit, linear and non -linear 
regression analysis), which led to cumulative benefit of $ 15 mil.  
• Solved a long -standing FCC mass and energy balance  (HMB)  closure 
issue by utilizing PIMS tool to represent the feed and products 
properties.

WORK E XPERIENCE  
Team Lead, Process Monitoring and Analysis (Fluid Catalytic Cracking 
(FCC) /Alky Team)   
ExxonMobil Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia  / March 2019 – Present   
•Coached and p lanned global project rollout s for 20 engineers. 
Collaborated with senior management to evaluate and improve KPI 
targets and key deliverables .  
•Investigated 7 HSE issues, identified corrective and preventative 
measures to ensure safe work environment as Safety Lead. Developed 5 
SOPs and wor k assessment guidelines to prevent losses and ensure 
team’s success.  
•Analyzed the feasibility of processing new  crude  and led the management 
of change (MOC) to revise the feed  properties  operating envelope which 
increased the refinery revenue by $10 mil pe r year.  
•Participated in  a HAZOP study for a refinery in Australia. Examined 200+ 
potential scenarios to identify risks and proposed steps to mitigate 
potential issues and hazards by utilizing PROII/HYSYS and P&ID.  
•Developed a catalyst utilization tool for FCC to optimize catalyst additions  
and catalyst additives such as DeS Ox, ZSM -5 and CO -Promoter  to save 
OPEX of $2 million per year. Worked with multinational catalyst vendor 
companies to conduct  catalyst selection stud ies for EM refineries.

ammonia, and petrochemical products.  
•Developed an economic and value chain model to increase the net 
profit of carbon monoxide and aceti
